sentences: Tema naha toon muutub kui tal süda soovib.
Nahka ei saa märkida kui see on liiga sooja.
context: The word 'nahka' translates to 'skin' or 'temperament'. In Estonian, it is used both literally (referring to the physical skin) and figuratively (describing a person's temperament). The examples include references to sensitive skin, changing mood, and inability to mark something that is too hot.
